title: TOML Parser
description: Parse TOML (Tom's Obvious Minimal Language) configuration files. TOML is a minimal configuration file format that's easy to read and maps unambiguously to a hash table.

motivation.why: TOML is the standard configuration format for Rust projects (Cargo.toml) and many modern tools. It's designed to be more readable than JSON while being more strictly defined than YAML.

inputFormat.description: TOML files contain key-value pairs, sections (tables), and support various data types including strings, integers, floats, booleans, arrays, and inline tables.

examples.description: Array of tables for repeated structures

outputFormat.description: The parser returns a TomlDocument with root key-values and named sections, each containing typed TomlValue enums.

root.description: Global key-value pairs before any section header

tables.description: Map of section names to their key-value pairs
